title: Ukraine Grain Deal Raises Tensions for European Farmers
description: When Russia’s war blocked vitally needed grains at Ukrainian ports, officials succeeded in finding other routes out. But the solution brought its own problems.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Xi Rebuffs the U.S.
description: Also, a small town in Australia hosted tens of thousands of eclipse watchers.

title: Search Halted for 3 Americans Missing Off the Mexican Coast
description: Kerry O’Brien, Frank O’Brien and William Gross, who were sailing aboard the Ocean Bound, were last heard from near Mazatlán, Mexico, on April 4.

title: British Man Died of Rare Blood Syndrome Linked to AstraZeneca’s Vaccine
description: One expert said the blood-clotting syndrome was estimated to occur in one in 50,000 people under 40 and one in 100,000 over 40 who received AstraZeneca’s vaccine.

title: ‘We Will Hunt You’: Ugandans Flee Ahead of Harsh Anti-Gay Law
description: The bill, passed last month, calls for life in prison for anyone engaging in same-sex relations. President Yoweri Museveni congratulated lawmakers for their “strong stand” against L.G.B.T.Q. people.

title: 1973: Moscow Walkout by Chinese Envoy
description: The official, Ma Lieh, left his seat during a speech at the Kremlin by a Soviet Politburo member, a sign of the strained relations between Moscow and Beijing.

title: NATO Chief Jens Stoltenberg Says Ukraine’s ‘Rightful Place’ Is in the Alliance
description: “I am here today with a simple message: NATO stands with Ukraine,” Jens Stoltenberg, the alliance’s secretary general, said at a joint news conference with the Ukrainian president.

title: NOAA Forecasters See a Respite for California
description: Less extreme spring temperatures could mean gradual snowmelt and lower flood risks, according to experts. “The picture is relatively optimistic,” one said.

title: Italy’s Senate Signs Off on Meloni’s Migrant Crackdown
description: The package is the first major take on immigration by the hard-right government of Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and would limit integration and create more detention facilities.

title: Israel’s Right-Wing Government Has Jewish Democrats at a Loss
description: American lawmakers defending Israel have often fallen back on what they call the countries’ shared democratic values. But defending the current far-right government is proving a lot harder.

title: U.S. Positioning Troops for Evacuation of American Embassy in Sudan
description: Fierce fighting has trapped people in the capital, Khartoum, and the United States says it is “conducting prudent planning” to get diplomatic staff members out.

title: Ukraine’s Social Media Stars Ditch Russian in Pivot to a War Footing
description: Russian was once the lingua franca of influencers in Ukraine. Now, not so much.

title: Stampede in Yemen Kills 78 People Gathering to Receive Holiday Donations
description: A crowd had gathered to collect handouts of a small sum of money ahead of the Eid al-Fitr holiday that marks the end of the holy fasting month of Ramadan for Muslims.

title: What We Know About the Fighting in Sudan
description: With two generals vying for power, residents in the capital, Khartoum, said the violence had destroyed hospitals, airfields and homes, and left civilians caught in the crossfire.

title: Pentagon’s Repatriation of Algerian Leaves 30 Prisoners at Guantánamo
description: The transfer was the sixth of a cleared prisoner in six months in a Biden administration surge to reduce the prison population.

title: What We Know About the Fighting in Sudan
description: With two generals vying for power, residents in the capital, Khartoum, said the violence had destroyed hospitals, airfields and homes, and left civilians caught in the crossfire.

title: E.U. Weighs Temporary Restrictions on Ukrainian Grain
description: An E.U. proposal would pause Ukrainian grain exports to five countries that say their farmers are being hurt by a glut of cheap imports. Here is what we’re covering:

title: Flocking to One of the Few Specks of Land in Sight of a Total Eclipse
description: Tens of thousands descended on a tiny town in Western Australia, hundreds of miles from any city, to view a celestial spectacle.

title: Democrats’ Numbers Problem
description: We look at the costs of Dianne Feinstein’s absence to the Democratic Party’s agenda.

title: As Xi Befriends World Leaders, He Hardens His Stance on the U.S.
description: China has rebuffed calls to restart high-level talks with the United States, raising the risk of confrontation in contested areas like the Taiwan Strait.

title: Biden to Pledge $500 Million to Stop Deforestation in Brazil
description: The promise to help Brazil protect the Amazon must be approved by Congress, where Republicans are opposed to foreign climate aid.

title: Yellen to Call for ‘Constructive’ China Relationship
description: The Treasury secretary will strike a more conciliatory note in a speech Thursday, following months of escalated tensions between the world’s two largest economies.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: India will soon have the world’s largest population.

title: Stampede in Yemen’s Capital Kills Dozens Seeking Food Aid, Houthis Say
description: Hundreds of people had gathered at a school for an event organized by merchants, according to the Houthi-run Interior Ministry.
